# Sai Surbehera

Sai Surbehera is a Machine Learning Engineer for Walmart's Algorithmic Search Experience Team, focusing on synthetic data generation for navigation. Holds a Master’s degree in Computer Science from Columbia University and a Bachelor’s degree in Information from the University of Michigan. Professional experience includes:

- Synthetic data generation for navigation and search experience optimization at Walmart Search; developed price prediction algorithms, cold start models, and click-through rate (CTR) prediction models for Walmart Search.
- Designed and implemented geo-coding algorithms for the Philadelphia Inquirer and Columbia Journalism.
- Built information extraction pipelines for American Family Insurance, enabling automated data extraction from unstructured sources.
- Developed relation extraction pipelines at Mindgram, focusing on identifying and structuring relationships within datasets.
- Created knowledge graph search and entity linking systems for University of Michigan Giving, supporting advanced search and data connectivity.
- Engineered theme-matching algorithms and summarization systems at University of Stellenbosch, facilitating content categorization and summarization.
- Applied GraphSage for fraud detection at AAA Insurance, leveraging graph neural networks for anomaly detection in insurance data.

Personal interests include working on independent projects, reading and writing about philosophy, and listening to music during free time.

## Contact

- Email: ss6365@columbia.com
- GitHub: https://github.com/saisurbehera

## Location

Based in New York City (NYC).
